intro: Epilyna ecallosa, commonly known as the rough epilyna, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas.
